channel.title: Stock on Life Reboot
channel.description: Recent content in Stock on Life Reboot

item.title: Dashi
item.description: A basic stock used for a lot of Japanese recipes.

item.title: Tonkotsu Stock
item.description:
Tonkotsu means “pork bone-broth” in Japanese. It is a rich, unctuous dish that coats the mouth as you consume it.

This tonkotsu ramen broth recipe takes a full day or at least overnight to make. Plan accordingly.

item.title: Beef Stock
item.description: A home made beef stock will give your dishes the depth of flavour required to excel.

item.title: Chicken Stock
item.description: Chicken stock made from necks, wings, backs and drumsticks. This will make a rich full flavoured stock. Wings provide a lot of skin, fat and gelatinous tissue which will break down and increase the luxuriousness of the stock.
